item.name: OWASP
API1:2019 Broken Object Level Authorization
Retrieve Patient From Another Doctor with Error

item.description: Broken Object Level Authorization occurs when a request to an object can be successfully done even if not authorized to the object

item.name: API2:2019 Broken User Authentication
item.description: Occurs when authentication mechanism are not implemented correctly and can be abused.

item.name: API3:2019 Excessive Data Exposure
item.description: Occurs when object properties are exposed without checking the data sensitivity and rely on the client to filter only the data they need.

item.name: API4:2019 Lack of Resources & Rate Limiting

exec: pm.test("Status Code is 429 --> Rate limiting works", function () {

item.description:
Occurs when a client can use a lot of the server resources which then leads to DoS and also makes brute force possible.

To Test this:

Go to API4:2019 Folder.

Click "Run"

Select Iterations

Wait for Testresults to return status 429

item.name: API5:2019 Broken Function Level Authorization
item.description: Occurs when the access control policy is not clear which then leads to administrative access when not in admin mode.

item.name: API6:2019 Mass Assignment
item.description: Occurs when objects from client requests are not filtered by an allowlist and therefore an attack by modifying object properties is possible.

item.name: API7:2019 Security Misconfiguration
item.description: Occurs when the configuration is incompleted of misconfigured (HTTP Headers, HTTP Methods, CORS,...)

item.name: API8:2019 Injection
item.description: Occurs when input is not validated and makes injectsion like SQL or command injections possible.

item.name: API9:2019 Improper Assets Management
item.description: Occurs when endpoints are exposed which doesn't need to be exposed which makes it easier for attackers to gain information.

item.name: API10:2019 Insufficient Logging & Monitoring
item.description:
Occurs when logging and monitoring is not complete or integrated into incident response which makes attacks less likely to be discovered.

Can't be tested with Postman so you need to send other requests and then check for logs.

Check that the requestor is logged with the sourceIP an action which was made with a timestamp.

Additionally, an incident response and disaster recovery need to be in-place to have a recovery mechanism.

You also need to make sure that the logging solution does not log only sensitive data which could be extracted by an attacker.
Collection of Requests to test OWASP API Top 10 [https://owasp.org/www-project-api-security/](https://owasp.org/www-project-api-security/)
